page.title: 15FORTON PRINCIPAL BUILDINGS.
page.content: FORTON HALL IS THE MOST IMPRESSIVE RESIDENCE IN THE VILLAGE, AND LIES SOUTH OF THE CROSSROADS, OUT OF SITE FROM THE MAIN ROAD AND ADJACENT TO "ALL SAINTS PARISH CHURCH". IT IS OWNED BY MR AND MRS HAMMOND AND WAS BUILT IN 1665,TAKING 100 MEN TO BUILD IT AT A COST OF Â£100. ON THE ORIGINAL SANDSTONE PORCH AT THE FRONT OF THE HALL ARE THE INITIALS "G.A.S.". THEY BELONG TO GERALD SKRYMSHER, WHO HAD THE HOUSE BUILT AS A DOWER HOUSE, FOR HIS MOTHER, THE WIFE OF SIR THOMAS SKRYMSHER, LORD OF AQUALATE MANOR. THE HALL WAS STILL PART OF THE MANOR UNTIL RECENTLY, WHEN THE EARL OF SHREWSBURY BOUGHT IT. THE HAMMONDS PURCHASED IT FROM THE EARL 2 YEARS AGO, IN 1983. THE HALL IS FACING EAST, IT HAS 4 STORIES.
